verses.verse: Be not thou envious <WH7065> against evil <WH7451> men <WH582>, neither desire <WH183> to be with them.
For their heart <WH3820> studieth <WH1897> destruction <WH7701>, and their lips <WH8193> talk <WH1696> of mischief <WH5999>.
Through wisdom <WH2451> is an house <WH1004> builded <WH1129>; and by understanding <WH8394> it is established <WH3559>:
And by knowledge <WH1847> shall the chambers <WH2315> be filled <WH4390> with all precious <WH3368> and pleasant <WH5273> riches <WH1952>.
A wise <WH2450> man <WH1397> is strong <WH5797>; yea, a man <WH376> of knowledge <WH1847> increaseth <WH553> strength <WH3581>.
For by wise counsel <WH8458> thou shalt make <WH6213> thy war <WH4421>: and in multitude <WH7230> of counsellers <WH3289> there is safety <WH8668>.
Wisdom <WH2454> is too high <WH7311> for a fool <WH191>: he openeth <WH6605> not his mouth <WH6310> in the gate <WH8179>.
He that deviseth <WH2803> to do evil <WH7489> shall be called <WH7121> a mischievous <WH4209> person <WH1167>.
The thought <WH2154> of foolishness <WH200> is sin <WH2403>: and the scorner <WH3887> is an abomination <WH8441> to men <WH120>.
If thou faint <WH7503> in the day <WH3117> of adversity <WH6869>, thy strength <WH3581> is small <WH6862>.
If thou forbear <WH2820> to deliver <WH5337> them that are drawn <WH3947> unto death <WH4194>, and those that are ready <WH4131> to be slain <WH2027>;

If thou sayest <WH559>, Behold, we knew <WH3045> it not; doth not he that pondereth <WH8505> the heart <WH3826> consider <WH995> it? and he that keepeth <WH5341> thy soul <WH5315>, doth not he know <WH3045> it? and shall not he render <WH7725> to every man <WH120> according to his works <WH6467>?
My son <WH1121>, eat <WH398> thou honey <WH1706>, because it is good <WH2896>; and the honeycomb <WH5317>, which is sweet <WH4966> to thy taste <WH2441>:

So shall the knowledge <WH3045> of wisdom <WH2451> be unto thy soul <WH5315>: when thou hast found <WH4672> it, then there shall be <WH3426> a reward <WH319>, and thy expectation <WH8615> shall not be cut off <WH3772>.
Lay not wait <WH693>, O wicked <WH7563> man, against the dwelling <WH5116> of the righteous <WH6662>; spoil <WH7703> not his resting place <WH7258>:
For a just <WH6662> man falleth <WH5307> seven times <WH7651>, and riseth up again <WH6965>: but the wicked <WH7563> shall fall <WH3782> into mischief <WH7451>.
Rejoice <WH8055> not when thine enemy <WH341> falleth <WH5307>, and let not thine heart <WH3820> be glad <WH1523> when he stumbleth <WH3782>:
Lest the LORD <WH3068> see <WH7200> it, and it displease <WH7489> <WH5869> him, and he turn away <WH7725> his wrath <WH639> from him.
Fret <WH2734> not thyself because of evil <WH7489> men, neither be thou envious <WH7065> at the wicked <WH7563>;
For there shall be no reward <WH319> to the evil <WH7451> man; the candle <WH5216> of the wicked <WH7563> shall be put out <WH1846>.
My son <WH1121>, fear <WH3372> thou the LORD <WH3068> and the king <WH4428>: and meddle <WH6148> not with them that are given to change <WH8138>:
For their calamity <WH343> shall rise <WH6965> suddenly <WH6597>; and who knoweth <WH3045> the ruin <WH6365> of them both <WH8147>?
These things also belong to the wise <WH2450>. It is not good <WH2896> to have respect <WH5234> of persons <WH6440> in judgment <WH4941>.
He that saith <WH559> unto the wicked <WH7563>, Thou art righteous <WH6662>; him shall the people <WH5971> curse <WH5344>, nations <WH3816> shall abhor <WH2194> him:
But to them that rebuke <WH3198> him shall be delight <WH5276>, and a good <WH2896> blessing <WH1293> shall come <WH935> upon them.
Every man shall kiss <WH5401> his lips <WH8193> that giveth <WH7725> a right <WH5228> answer <WH1697>.
Prepare <WH3559> thy work <WH4399> without <WH2351>, and make it fit <WH6257> for thyself in the field <WH7704>; and afterwards <WH310> build <WH1129> thine house <WH1004>.
Be not a witness <WH5707> against thy neighbour <WH7453> without cause <WH2600>; and deceive <WH6601> not with thy lips <WH8193>.
Say <WH559> not, I will do <WH6213> so to him as he hath done <WH6213> to me: I will render <WH7725> to the man <WH376> according to his work <WH6467>.
I went <WH5674> by the field <WH7704> of the slothful <WH376> <WH6102>, and by the vineyard <WH3754> of the man <WH120> void <WH2638> of understanding <WH3820>;
And, lo, it was all grown over <WH5927> with thorns <WH7063>, and nettles <WH2738> had covered <WH3680> the face <WH6440> thereof, and the stone <WH68> wall <WH1444> thereof was broken down <WH2040>.
Then I saw <WH2372>, and considered it well <WH7896> <WH3820>: I looked <WH7200> upon it, and received <WH3947> instruction <WH4148>.
Yet a little <WH4592> sleep <WH8142>, a little <WH4592> slumber <WH8572>, a little <WH4592> folding <WH2264> of the hands <WH3027> to sleep <WH7901>:
So shall thy poverty <WH7389> come <WH935> as one that travelleth <WH1980>; and thy want <WH4270> as an armed <WH4043> man <WH376>.
